Reviews.Content: Near train Station We stayed in the Hotel Vasari for our one day stop in Florence. It's extremely close to the train station. The rooms were bigger than normal and along with the private bathroom. The air conditioning is only on for certain times mostly during the later afternoon through the morning but I didn't really notice, it was on anytime I had been in the room. We walked to all the destinations in Florence but the bus system seemed to work seamlessly. The breakfast in the morning was decent. The staff was friendly. I would stay here again or longer if I had the opportunity.
Reviews.Author: Schmooles

Reviews.Content: Loved the Service and Location The Hotel is fairly priced for the amenities and the staff is more than willing to please and help in any way possible. We would definitely stay here again.
Reviews.Author: busymom789

Reviews.Content: Not a summer location Great location for station and Via Faenzi which has just about everything a traveller requires and leads direct to the Duomo etc. Room was simple but clean and good size. The main drawback was the noise - as long as you can keep the windows closed the double glazing works ok, but the cooling system was inadequate (useless?) and in hot weather this would not be a comfortable/peaceful place to stay unless you can get one of the few rooms at the back. Breakfast was simple - enough said.
Reviews.Author: wilsonb

Reviews.Content: Like sleeping in a drum Fairly clean, nicely decorated but unbelievably noisy. Also, no wake up call and taxi was 15-20 minutes late which leads me to believe that he hadn't called the taxi until we got down to the desk. The fare to the airport was very high so it really isn't worth spending this much money on a room plus the taxi fare when you don't really get to sleep, anyway.
Reviews.Author: egtresys
